sen.j: 無宿（むしゅく）は、江戸時代において、現在の戸籍台帳と呼べる宗門人別改帳から名前を外された者のことである。
sen.e: Mushuku means people in the Edo period whose names were excluded from Shumon-Ninbetsu-Aratame-Cho (The Village People Register of Religious Faith and Relationship) which can be considered family register as of now.

Mushuku means people in the Edo period whose names were excluded from Shumon-Ninbetsu-Aratame-Cho (The Village People Register of Religious Faith and Relationship) which is the equivalent of today's family register.
sen.cmt: as of nowでは意味が不適切なので修正しました。
sen.e: Mushuku means people in the Edo period whose names were excluded from Shumon-Ninbetsu-Aratame-Cho (The Village People Register of Religious Faith and Relationship) which is the equivalent of today's family register.

sen.j: 無宿には、江戸時代は連座の制度があったため、その累が及ぶことを恐れた親族から不行跡を理由に勘当された町人、軽罪を犯して追放刑を受けた者もいた。
sen.e: Since guilt-by-association system was taken in the Edo period, some mushuku were townspeople who had been disowned by his family because of his misconduct for fear of being involved in, and people who had been transported due to misdemeanor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.cmt: 全角スペースを半角にしました。
sen.e: Since guilt-by-association system was taken in the Edo period, some mushuku were townspeople who had been disowned by his family because of his misconduct for fear of being involved in, and people who had been transported due to misdemeanor.

sen.j: 多くは天明の大飢饉や江戸幕府の重商主義政策による農業の破綻により、農村で生活を営むことが不可能になった百姓だった。
sen.e: Yet, many of them were farmers who became impossible to live in the farm village because of the Tenmei Famine or agricultural failure caused by the Mercantilism policy of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 村や町から出て一定期間を経ると、人別帳から名前が除外されるため、無宿は「帳外」（ちょうはずれ）とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: Mushuku was also called "Chohazure" (homelessness) since his name was eliminated from the Shumon-Ninbetsu-Aratame-Cho after a certain period since his leaving the village or town.
Mushuku was also called "Chohazure" (off the registry) since his name was eliminated from the Shumon-Ninbetsu-Aratame-Cho after a certain period since his leaving the village or town.
sen.cmt: homelessnessでは伝わりにくいと思い修正しました。

sen.j: 田沼意次が幕政に関与した天明年間には折からの政情不安により無宿が大量に江戸周辺に流入し、様々な凶悪犯罪を犯すようになった。
sen.e: In the Tenmei Era when Okitsugu TANUMA involved in the shogunate government, due to political instability that existed at that time, many Mushuku flew in and around Edo and became to commit various atrocious crime.

sen.j: そのため、それらを防ぐため、幕府は様々な政策を講じることになる。
sen.e: Thus the bakufu, to prevent such crime, was taking various political measures.

sen.j: 犯罪を犯し、捕縛された無宿は「武州無宿権兵衛」、「上州無宿次郎吉」等、出身地を冠せられて呼ばれた。
sen.e: The mushuku who had committed crime and arrested was called with his native place at the beginning, such as, "Bushu-Mushuku-Gonbei " and "Joshu-Mushuku-Jirokichi".

A mushuku who had committed crime and been arrested was called by a name with prefixed name of his native place, such as "Bushu-Mushuku-Gonbei" (homeless Gonbei from Bushu) or "Joshu-Mushuku-Jirokichi" (homeless Jirokichi from Joshu).
